ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: See question one for summary. I would recommend Maurie's class to anyone with an interest in 19th-c. French literature, art, music, science, or culture. I would also recommend the class to anyone with an interest in 19th and/or 20th Western Europe and/or cultural history. I feel the course was particularly instructive re: these different subjects/approaches.

Really a high-level survey course, but I think this works well. It gives good coverage of the period, is a accessible to non specialists, but the theoretical readings open it up to some very challenging approaches. A good balance.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This was not a period of French literature that I was especially familiar with, so the course helped me fill a gap in my knowledge. The class was also helpful insofar as it introduced me to a cultural-historical mode of reading that I had not really encountered before. I got this mostly through the secondary readings, but also through the exercise of the historical presentation and through Maurie's own readings.

I work on nineteenth-century French literature so it was very helpful. I actually liked the survey course aspect as many professors seem to feel obliged to teach courses that are "out there" to graduate students.
